text:
Is there a way to append/concat of a `::SecretBuffer` without stringifying everything?
I am writing something where I need the user to enter credential info interactively.
I would like to automatically append `"SomePrefix//"` to the username.

I can get around it by reading it, but that seems like I am entirely sidestepping the purpose of the `::SecretBuffer`
```userinput = Base.getpass("enter username")
username = "SomePrefix//" * read(userinput, string)```

text:
Here’s an example
```julia> userinput = Base.getpass("enter username")
enter username:
SecretBuffer("*******")

julia> b = Base.SecretBuffer()
SecretBuffer("*******")

julia> write(b, "domain//")
8

julia> write(b, userinput)
4

julia> seekstart(b)
SecretBuffer("*******")

julia> read(b, String)
"domain//test"```
